eadid.publicid: -//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NcD::William Patrick Calhoun papers, 1903-1912 //EN

titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Patrick Calhoun papers, 1903-1912
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, January 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection contains letters chiefly concerning the controversy over whether or not the last Confederate Cabinet meeting was held in South Carolina or Georgia. Principal political figures are discussed. There is also a letter of 1912 pertaining to the gubernatorial election in S.C.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: William Patrick Calhoun Papers, 1903-1912, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Attorney and nephew of John C. Calhoun.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains letters chiefly concerning the controversy over whether or not the last Confederate Cabinet meeting was held in South Carolina or Georgia. Principal political figures are discussed. There is also a letter of 1912 pertaining to the gubernatorial election in S.C.
